title: What limits does human biological evolution place on social and technological evolution? - Quora

response.answer_text: What limits are placed on our future social/tech evolution by our biology? None. We're at the point of creating AGI. That will transform society and technology. Ah, I hear you say. But we are still human, with human wants. Aha, I say: AGI will allow us to effectively meddle with our genome to remove the old constraints. Want to become a bush? No problem! Read Iain M. Banks' “Culture” series for an intelligent exploration of what we might become.

Given the current state of things humans cannot fly, and any technology that requires human flight will fail. Any technology that assumes that a human operator is 14 feet tall won’t do to well either. I think you get the idea. Any technology or cultural change that exceeds human abilities is not likely to accomplish much.
